API Reference

Manifolds

Tools for generating Riemannian manifolds and product manifolds.

The module consists of two classes: Manifold and ProductManifold .The Manifold class represents hyperbolic, Euclidean, or spherical manifolds based on curvature. The ProductManifold class supports products of multiple manifolds, combining their geometric properties to create mixed-curvature. Both classes includes functions for different key geometric operations.

class manify.manifolds.Manifold(curvature, dim, device='cpu', stereographic=False)

Bases: object

Tools for generating Riemannian manifolds.

Parameters:

  • curvature (float) – The curvature of the manifold. Negative for hyperbolic, zero for Euclidean, and positive for spherical manifolds.

  • dim (int) – The dimension of the manifold.

  • device (str, optional) – The device on which the manifold is stored (default: “cpu”).

  • stereographic (bool, optional) – Whether to use stereographic coordinates for the manifold.

apply(f)

Decorator for logmap -> function -> expmap. If a base point is not provided, use the origin.

Parameters:

f (Callable) – Function.

Return type:

Callable

Returns:

Callable representing the composed map.

dist(X, Y)

Inherit distance function from the geoopt manifold.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points1 n_dim']) – (n_points1, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

  • Y (Float[Tensor, 'n_points2 n_dim']) – (n_points2, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

Returns:

(n_points1, n_points2) Tensor of distances between points.

Return type:

distance

dist2(X, Y)

Inherit squared distance function from the geoopt manifold.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points1 n_dim']) – (n_points1, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

  • Y (Float[Tensor, 'n_points2 n_dim']) – (n_points2, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

Returns:

(n_points1, n_points2) Tensor of squared distances between points.

Return type:

distance

expmap(u, base=None)

Exponential map of tangent vector u at base point.

Parameters:

  • u (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – Tensor representing the tangent vector at the base point to map.

  • base (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']]) – Tensor representing the base point for the exponential map. Defaults to self.mu0 if not provided.

Return type:

Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']

Returns:

Tensor representing the result of the exponential map applied to u at the base point.

inner(X, Y)

Compute the inner product of manifolds.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points1 n_dim']) – (n_points1, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

  • Y (Float[Tensor, 'n_points2 n_dim']) – (n_points2, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

Returns:

(n_points1, n_points2) Tensor of inner products between points.

Return type:

inner_product

inverse_stereographic(*points)

Convert the manifold from its stereographic coordinates back to the original coordinates. If points are given, convert them as well.

Formula for inverse stereographic projection: X0 = (1 + sign(K) * ||y||**2) / (1 - sign(K) * ||y||**2) Xi = 2 * yi / (1 - sign(K) * ||y||**2)

Source: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1911.08411

Return type:

Tuple[Manifold, ...]

log_likelihood(z, mu=None, sigma=None)

Probability density function for WN(z ; mu, Sigma) in manifold

Parameters:

  • z (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim']) – (n_points”, “n_ambient_dim) Tensor of points on the manifold for which the likelihood is computed.

  • mu (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim']]) – (n_points”, “n_ambient_dim) Tensor representing the mean of the distribution. Defaults to self.mu0.

  • sigma (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim n_dim']]) – (n_points”, “n_dim”, “n_dim) Tensor representing the covariance matrix. Defaults to identity matrix.

Return type:

Float[Tensor, 'n_points']

Returns:

(n_points) Tensor containing the log-likelihood of the points z under the distribution with mean mu and covariance sigma.

logmap(x, base=None)

Logarithmic map of point on manifold x at base point.

Parameters:

  • x (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – Tensor representing the point on the manifold for the logarithmic map.

  • base (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']]) – Tensor representing the base point for the map. Defaults to self.mu0 if not provided.

Return type:

Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']

Returns:

Tensor representing the result of the logarithmic map from base to x on the manifold.

pdist(X)

Compute pairwise distances between embeddings.

Parameters:

X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

Returns:

(n_points, n_points) Tensor of pairwise distances.

Return type:

dists

pdist2(X)

Compute pairwise squared distances between embeddings.

Parameters:

X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor of points in the manifold.

Returns:

(n_points, n_points) Tensor of squared distances.

Return type:

dists2

sample(z_mean=None, sigma=None)

Sample from the variational distribution.

Parameters:

  • z_mean (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim']]) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor representing the mean of the sample distribution. Defaults to self.mu0.

  • sigma_factorized – List of tensors representing factorized covariance matrices for each manifold.

Return type:

Union[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim'], Tuple[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim'], Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']]]

Returns:

Tensor or tuple of tensor(n_points, n_ambient_dim) representing the sampled points on the manifold. If return_tangent is True, also returns the tangent vectors with shape (n_points, n_dim).

stereographic(*points)

Convert the manifold to its stereographic equivalent. If points are given, convert them as well.

Formula for stereographic projection: rho_K(x) = x[1:] / (1 + sqrt(|K|) * x[0])

Source: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1911.08411

Return type:

Tuple[Manifold, ...]

to(device)

Move objects to a specified device

Parameters:

device (str) – (str) The device to which the manifold will be moved.

Returns:

The updated manifold object.

Return type:

self

class manify.manifolds.ProductManifold(signature, device='cpu', stereographic=False)

Bases: Manifold

Tools for generating Riemannian manifolds.

Parameters:

  • Signature ((Tuple[float, int]) A list for the signature for the product manifold)

  • device ((str) The device on which the manifold is stored (default: "cpu").)

  • stereographic ((bool) Whether to use stereographic coordinates for the manifold.)

factorize(X, intrinsic=False)

Factorize the embeddings into the individual manifolds.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']) – (n_points”, “n_dim) tensor representing the embeddings to be factorized.

  • intrinsic (bool) – bool for whether to use intrinsic dimensions of the manifolds. Defaults to False.

Return type:

List[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim_manifold']]

Returns:

(List[Tensor]) list of tensors representing the factorized embeddings in each manifold.

gaussian_mixture(num_points=1000, num_classes=2, num_clusters=None, seed=None, cov_scale_means=1.0, cov_scale_points=1.0, regression_noise_std=0.1, task='classification', adjust_for_dims=False)

Generate a set of labeled samples from a Gaussian mixture model.

Parameters:

  • num_points (int) – The number of points to generate.

  • num_classes (int) – The number of classes to generate.

  • num_clusters (Optional[int]) – The number of clusters to generate. If None, defaults to num_classes.

  • seed (Optional[int]) – An optional seed for the random number generator.

  • cov_scale_means (float) – The scale of the covariance matrix for the means.

  • cov_scale_points (float) – The scale of the covariance matrix for the points.

  • regression_noise_std (float) – The standard deviation of the noise for regression labels.

  • task (Literal['classification', 'regression']) – The type of labels to generate. Either “classification” or “regression”.

  • adjust_for_dims (bool) – Whether to adjust the covariance matrices for the number of dimensions in each manifold.

Returns:

A tensor of shape (num_points, ambient_dim) containing the generated samples. class_assignments: A tensor of shape (num_points,) containing the class assignments of the samples.

Return type:

samples

log_likelihood(z, mu=None, sigma_factorized=None)

Probability density function for WN(z ; mu, Sigma) in manifold

Parameters:

  • z (Float[Tensor, 'batch_size n_dim']) – (batch_size, n_dim) Tensor representing the points for which the log-likelihood is computed.

  • mu (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_dim']]) – (n_dim,) Tensor representing the mean of the distribution.

  • sigma_factorized (Optional[List[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim_manifold n_dim_manifold']]]) – List of tensors representing factorized covariance matrices for each manifold.

Return type:

Float[Tensor, 'batch_size']

Returns:

(batch_size,) Tensor of shape containing the log-likelihood of each point in z with mean mu and covariance sigma.

params()

Returns scales for all component manifolds

sample(z_mean=None, sigma_factorized=None)

Sample from the variational distribution.

Parameters:

  • z_mean (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']]) – (n_points, n_dim) Tensor representing the mean of the sample distribution. Defaults to self.mu0.

  • sigma_factorized (Optional[List[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim_manifold n_dim_manifold']]]) – List of tensors representing factorized covariance matrices for each manifold.

Return type:

Union[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim'], Tuple[Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_ambient_dim'], Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_dim']]]

Returns:

Tensor or tuple of tensor of shape (n_points, n_ambient_dim) representing sampled points on the manifold. If return_tangent is True, also returns the tangent vectors with shape (n_points, n_dim).

stereographic(*points)

Convert the manifold to its stereographic equivalent. If points are given, convert them as well.

Formula for stereographic projection: rho_K(x) = x[1:] / (1 + sqrt(|K|) * x[0])

Source: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1911.08411

Return type:

Tuple[ProductManifold, ...]

to(device)

Move all components to a new device

Curvature Estimation

delta_hyperbolicity

Compute delta-hyperbolicity of a metric space.

greedy_method

Greedy selection of signatures, as described in Tabaghi et al. at https://arxiv.org/pdf/2102.10204.

sectional_curvature

Embedders

coordinate_learning

Implementation for coordinate training and optimization

losses

Implementation of different measurement metrics

siamese

Siamese network embedder

vae

Product space variational autoencoder implementation

Predictors

decision_tree

Decision tree and random forest predictors for product space manifolds.

kappa_gcn

Kappa GCN implementation

kernel

Implementation for kernel matrix calculation

midpoint

Compute the angular midpoints between two angular coordinates in different geometric spaces

perceptron

Product space perceptron implementation

svm

Utilities

benchmarks

Implementation for benchmarking different product space machine learning methods

Dataloaders for different datasets

Preprocessing with link prediction
